definitions.definition: a heavy metal object that is attached to a rope or chain and dropped over the side of a ship or boat to keep it in one place

examples.text: We raised the anchor and set sail.
We **weighed anchor** *(= pulled it out of the water)*.
The ship lay at anchor two miles off the rocky coast.

definitions.definition: a person or thing that gives somebody a feeling of safety
a person who presents a live radio or television programme and introduces reports by other people; an anchorman or anchorwoman

examples.text: She was questioned by an NBC anchor about her trip.

wordOrigin: Old English ancor, ancra, via Latin from Greek ankura; reinforced in Middle English by Old French ancre. The current form is from anchora, an erroneous Latin spelling. The verb (from Old French ancrer) dates from Middle English.
